Periph+Var.Label: \zendperiph
Periph+Var.Description: End of a periph section, if you’re not starting a new periphery. Must be the only thing on the line.

Periph+Var.Label: \zgetperiph|id\*
Periph+Var.Description: Get (use) the periphery stored earlier by \periph comment|id=”preface”

Periph+Var.Label: \zgap[|dimen]\*
Periph+Var.Description: Insert a vertical gap of given dimension (6pt, 5mm, 2cm, 1.5in, etc.)

Legal.Label: \zfiga|anchor\*
Legal.Description: Insert image from piclist with given anchor

Legal.Label: \zccimg by-nd|size="size" pgpos="pgpos" scale="scale"\*
Legal.Description: Insert Create Commons logo: by, by-nc, by-nc-nd, by-nc-sa, by-nd, by-sa; pgpos=p.

Legal.Label: \zimagecopyrights[LANG]
Legal.Description: Insert image copyrights for a language

ISBN+QR.Label: Generate ISBN bar code for a specific number.
ISBN+QR.Description: Generate ISBN bar code for fixed number.  Height can be one of (normal, medium, short).

ISBN+QR.Label: Generate ISBN bar code (if ISBN number exists)
ISBN+QR.Description: If the 'isbn' variable has been set, then this will generate a code.

ISBN+QR.Label: Generate QR code (to link to other content)
ISBN+QR.Description: Generate a QR-code from attribute data (which may not contain double-quotes)

Contents.Label: \ztocbefore…\ztocbefore*
Contents.Description: Insert table rows (\tr \cat toc\cat*... ) before the TOC

Contents.Label: \ip \ztoc[|order]\*
Contents.Description: Insert Table of Contents of given order (main, ot, nt, dc, pre, post, heb, sorta, sortb, sortc)

Contents.Label: \ztocafter …. \ztocafter*
Contents.Description: Insert table rows (\tr \tc1 …. ) after the TOC.

Contents.Label: \zthumbtab bookname
Contents.Description: Set the thumb tab text for this book (instead of using \toc3)

Pages.Label: \resetpagenums pnum
Pages.Description: Reset page numbers (negative for Roman numerals)

Pages.Label: \zNeedOddPage
Pages.Description: Insert an “empty” page if the current page is even

Pages.Label: \zNeedEvenPage
Pages.Description: Insert an “empty” page if the current page is off

Pages.Label: \zNeedQuadPage
Pages.Description: Insert 1, 2 or 3 “empty” pages if the current page is not divisible by 4

Pages.Label: \zfillsignature\*
Pages.Description: Fill a signature to the given modulo of pages. Note, uses the actual page count. Optional ‘pagenums’ parameter ‘no’=\nopagenums, ‘do’=\dopagenums), extra ensures at least this many pages will be added.

Label.Label: \zlabel|uniquelabel\*
Label.Description: Remember where uniquelabel is (page and reference)

Label.Label: \zpage|uniquelabel\*
Label.Description: Output the page number for uniquelabel

Label.Label: \zref|id=”uniquelabel” show=”b_c:v”\*
Label.Description: Output chapter:verse for uniquelabel (show: b=book, c=chapter, v=verse, _=space, anything else is copied)
Label.CodeSnippet: \p Refer to sidebar on culture in \zref|id=”cultural_clues” show=”b_c:v”\*

Condition.Label: \zifvarset|var="varname"\*
Condition.Description: Sets conditional text if varname is set. emptyOK="T" ⇒ empty is true, emptyOK="F" ⇒ empty is false.

Condition.Label: \ztruetext …\ztruetext*
Condition.Description: Include contents if condition is true

Condition.Label: \zfalsetext …\zfalsetext*
Condition.Description: Include contents if condition is false

Condition.Label: \zifhooks|marker\*
Condition.Description: Does marker have a hook, set conditional true

Diglot.Label: \zglot|[col]\*
Diglot.Description: Use formatting for diglot column col, in a monoglot section. Return to normal formatting with \zglot|\*

Diglot.Label: \zgetperiph|side="L|R" id="preface"\*
Diglot.Description: Get (use) the appropriate L/R periphery stored earlier by \periph comment|id=”preface”

Diglot.Label: \ztoc|main[L|R]\*
Diglot.Description: Insert L/R Table of Contents of given order (main, ot, nt, dc, pre, post, heb, sorta, sortb, sortc)

Other.Label: \onebody
Other.Description: Set \BodyColumns=1 for single column body text

Other.Label: \twobody
Other.Description: Set \BodyColumns=2 for double column body text

Other.Label: \ztmon
Other.Description: Turn on TeX’s tracing macros (for debugging)

Adjust.Label: Shrink text to 95% width ('\p' > '\p^95')
Adjust.Description:
Shrink one or more paragraphs by 5%
(remember to reference the PREVIOUS verse).

Adjust.Label: Shrink text to 97% width ('\p' > '\p^97')
Adjust.Description:
Shrink one or more paragraphs by 3%
(remember to reference the PREVIOUS verse).

Adjust.Label: Stretch text to 103% width ('\p' > '\p^103')
Adjust.Description:
Stretch one or more paragraphs by 3%
(remember to reference the PREVIOUS verse).

Adjust.Label: Stretch text to 105% width ('\p' > '\p^105')
Adjust.Description:
Stretch one or more paragraphs by 5%
(remember to reference the PREVIOUS verse).

Change.Label: in '\f .+?\f\*':  'Syria'  >  'Aram'
Change.Description: Find and replace WITHIN a specific context.

Change.Label: at LUK 2:53 in '\f .+?\f\*':  'Syria'  >  'Aram'
Change.Description: Location AND context specific find and replace (e.g. for the footnote found in a particular verse, change Syria to Aram)

Insert.Label: Insert a page break
Insert.Description: Insert a page break before the introductory outline. Note that you will have to translate the word 'Outline'.

Insert.Label: Insert line break within Intro Outline
Insert.Description: Within the \io1 line, break the line between 'some' and 'words'.

Insert.Label: Insert a rule before \c 1 starts
Insert.Description: Insert a rule after the intro (for all books)

Insert.Label: Insert a shorter rule before any chapter starts
Insert.Description: Insert a shorter and thinner rule before a chapter begins (for all books)

Insert.Label: Insert an ornamental rule before any chapter starts
Insert.Description: Insert an ornamental rule before a chapter begins (for all books)

Insert.Label: Insert a page break at specific location
Insert.Description: This example demonstrates how to insert a page break at specific location within a certain book (TDX).

Insert.Label: Insert a picture at specific reference
Insert.Description: Insert an illustration at a particular reference. This is NOT the best way to insert an illustration, but shows what is possible. It is better to insert the illustration in Paratext, and/or use the PicList.
Insert.CodeSnippet: at EPH 6:13 '(soldier.)' > '\1\\fig A Roman soldier complete with armor|alt="Roman soldier" src="ArmorOfGodDiagram.png" size="col" ref="6:14-18"\\fig*'

Insert.Label: Insert book separator pages
Insert.Description: Insert book separator pages using heading information

Format.Label: Add 3-letter book codes to headers (temporarily)
Format.Description: When typesetting in another script it is useful to temporarily add readable headers using the 3-letter book code. To make these generated \h1 codes to appear in the header, use the 'Book Alt (\h1)' option on the Header+Footer tab.

Format.Label: Allow linebreaks after in-word hyphens
Format.Description: This will insert a zero-width space after in-word hyphens allowing the line to break there if needed.

Format.Label: Make glossary entries list items
Format.Description:
Only within the Glossary, changes a normal paragraph \p marker to be a list item \li for paragraphs with a \k (keyword/entry), and to \pi for subsequent paragraphs.

Note that as an alternative you can use book-specific styling instead (the style 'id:GLO|p' could be added to change how \p gets styled within the Glossary).

Format.Label: Make \ior\* consistent
Format.Description: Remove the space before the \ior\* markers to make the right edge consistent in \io# lines.

Format.Label: Auto lengthen poetry
Format.Description: Short \q1 and \q2 lines work great for 2-col layouts. But for a single column layout, we can merge all \q2 into the previous \q1, and then turn every other \q1 into a \q2 to make it look like poetry.

Format.Label: Add section headers to Strong's index
Format.Description: Just for the XXS book, insert the first letter of each section of verncular renderings before the block of renderings with their Strong's H and G numbers.

Format.Label: Place GLO cross-references in parentheses
Format.Description: Just for the GLO book, put (parentheses) around the \xt cross-references\xt*. (Mt 16.18, Ap 8.3, 9.31)

Format.Label: Suppress introductory material for *some* books
Format.Description: In order to suppress the intro material (\i- markers before \c 1) in specific books (but keep it for others) replace BAK,XXA,XXE with whichever books you want the intro material stripped from.

Punctuation.Label: Use narrow no-break space between single and double quote
Punctuation.Description: Place a narrow no-break space (\u202F) between single and double quotes.

Punctuation.Label: French punctuation rules
Punctuation.Description:
Insert Narrow No Break Space U+202F before certain punctuation.
Remove U+202F between certain punctuation.
Remove U+202F if colon follows a number.
Remove spaces before English closing guillemets.
Insert Narrow No Break Space U+202F after opening guillemets.
Remove spaces after English opening guillemets.

Punctuation.Label: Change spaces before final punctuation into no-break narrow space
Punctuation.Description: To prevent sentence-final punctuation dropping onto the next line as an orphan, use a no-break narro space instead.

Other.Label: Drop (remove) an illustration
Other.Description: Remove an illustration (\fig ... \fig\*) from a specific location.

Other.Label: Combine \toc2 and \toc3 for Table of Contents
Other.Description:
Append the contents of \toc3 to the end of \toc2 giving Table of Contents lines like this:
Matthew (Mat).......1
Mark (Mrk).........57
Luke (Luk)........112
etc.
Note that you may need to change the \toc# numbers, or re-arrange the expression if the order doesn't match the rule.

Other.Label: Use Section headers \s or \s1 for Table of Contents
Other.Description: Change the existing \toc3 marker to \zthumbtab, remove \toc1 and \toc2 markers; then generate new \toc1 markers from the \s (or \s1) markers in the text to populate the Table of Contents with section headers.

Other.Label: Change \p to \nb
Other.Description: No-break paragraph: Commonly used in cases where the previous paragraph spans the chapter boundary.

Insert.Label: Insert a side bar with Category
Insert.Description: Insert a side bar with a category of 'People'
Insert.CodeSnippet:
\esb \cat People\cat*
\p Place contents of Sidebar in here...
\esbe

Insert.Label: Insert a picture
Insert.Description: Insert an illustration at a particular reference.
Insert.CodeSnippet: \fig Optional Caption for Picture|alt="Roman soldier" src="ArmorOfGodDiagram.png" size="col" ref="6:14-18"\fig\*

Rules/Lines.Label: Insert a simple rule
Rules/Lines.Description: Insert a horizontal line (rule) across the page / column.

Page Nums.Label: Set custom page numbers (Header/Footer)
Page Nums.Description:
PTXprint makes it easy to set the Running Header (RH) and Running Footer (RF) for most common uses. However there are many more options that can be used if needed. Modify the inserted snippet as needed by choosing (one|options) in each segment. The resulting line(s) of code should look something like this:
  \def\RFevenleft{\pagenumber}
  \def\RFoddright{\pagenumber}

- RH means running header, RF running footer,
- noV means pages with no scripture verses, title means the title page, and nothing in that slot means normal pages,
- odd/even is referring to the page numbers,
- left|center|right are the 3 the positions within the header/footer.

Verses.Label: Show bridged verses at the start of chapters
Verses.Description: Generally people do not want to show the verse number for verse 1 at the start of a chapter. But they may want to show a bridged verse in such a situation.

Verses.Label: Paragraph Initial Verses
Verses.Description: This snippet limits verse numbers so that only the first verse in a paragraph is shown. It is typically used in conjunction with marginal verses for reader editions where only limited verse hints are required.

Verses.Label: Suppress hyphen between bridged verses
Verses.Description: When using marginal verses, if you want to suppress the hyphen that normally comes between bridged verses (so that vertical stacks don't show the hyphen) then place this code before the \bridgeVerses lines:

Verses.Label: Avoid two marginal verses crashing into each other
Verses.Description: Marginal verse numbers get printed in the margin beside the text. Sometimes, where there is a short verse, two verse numbers appear in the same line. This causes a crash between the two marginal verse numbers. One way around this is to tell the ptx macros to bridge two verses and depending on the horizontal space available may cause the verses to stack vertically.

Verses.Label: Apply rounded rectangular box to bridged verses
Verses.Description: This applies the specified rounded rectangular box (in .pdf format) to bridged verses

Hooks.Label: \sethook{pos}{mrkr}{code}
Hooks.Description:
Runs code at pos (before|start|end|after) style marker:
before  - Runs before the style is set for the marker
start   - Runs within the styling of the marker before any text is output
end    - Runs before the marker closes or the paragraph is closed for a paragraph style
after   - Runs after the marker is closed and after the paragraph is finished for a paragraph style.

Hooks.Label: \setcvhook{#1}{code}
Hooks.Description:
Runs code at the start of the reference #1
e.g. GEN1.2 - At GEN 1:2
GEN3.0 - Just before chapter 3 of Genesis
all3.0 - Just before chapter 3 in all books

Hooks.Label: \setbookhook{pos}{GEN}{code}
Hooks.Description: Runs code at pos (start|end) of GEN.

Hooks.Label: \setbookhook{end}{final}{code}
Hooks.Description: Runs code at end of last book

Hooks.Label: \sethook{final}{afterincludes}{code}
Hooks.Description: Runs code after the ??? fill in the blanks ???

Hooks.Label: \sethook{page}{2}{code}
Hooks.Description: Runs code just after page 1 has been written to the PDF.

Hooks.Label: \setbetweenhook{mkr1}{mkr2}{code}
Hooks.Description:
Runs code between paragraphs mkr1 and mkr2.
e.g. insert a rule between the end of the introduction and before the chapter number.

Tweaks.Label: Reset callers (for \f and \x) at start of each book
Tweaks.Description: Reset the footnote and cross-reference callers at the start of every book.

Tweaks.Label: Nudge chapter number down at specific \nb chapters
Tweaks.Description: The Burmese digit 6 rises rather high and crashes into the previous line when an \nb (no-break para) is used after a \c chapter. This snippet demonstrates how to lower the \nb chapter number by a smidgen for the given references (in this example: JHN 16, 2CO 6, HEB 6).

Tweaks.Label: Forces better calculation of the number of lines
Tweaks.Description: Sometimes when your apply a +1 to a reference in an AdjList, it ends up doing a +2. To prevent this unwanted behaviour, you can force a more fine-grained adjustment at the specific verse location.

Tweaks.Label: Set a larger space before footnote caller in the text
Tweaks.Description: If the space before a footnote caller (defined by style zcf) needs to be increased, then this can be done by adding the following line.

Tweaks.Label: Move the qr word up to the end of previous line (if space permits)
Tweaks.Description: Used in poetry and/or song books to allow a short qr word to move up to the previous word as long as there is adequate space (defined here as 0.3em) between the end of the last word, and the qr word, like 'Selah'.

Strong's.Label: Tabbed indent for glossary or Strong's index
Strong's.Description: When typesetting an indented list, such as a glossary or Strongs index, it looks neater if the main body starts at the same indent position as the rest of the paragraph. In this example, the Strongs number is in bold \bd ... \bd\* and we can add a 'tab' after the Strongs number to make things line up neatly. Note that the \setbookhook restricts this change to just the 'XXS' book.

Strong's.Label: Change Strong's numbers from the 4-digit cell into a 4-in-a-line number
Strong's.Description: The 4-digit cell numbers for Strong's cross-references are a very handy and compact form, but these are not searchable in the PDF. If you want to see the 'unpacked' version of these numbers then add a new style \\myxts which can be styled as needed and add this snippet.

Other.Label: Special page numbering for a specific book
Other.Description:
I need the page number for the glossary to restart numbering at one, and be prefixed with G-

First, we reset the page number to one,  and then redefine the macro that prints the pagenumber.  (`\\folio` prints lower case roman numerals if the page number is negative, and numbers starting from 1 if positive).

Other.Label: Horiz rule to fill left and right edges of \s2 titles
Other.Description: When a number of minor section headings need to stand out from the surrounding text without occupying more vertical space, using a rule which fills out from the heading to the margin on each side can be quite an elegant solution.

Other.Label: Table of Contents right-align column 2
Other.Description: It sometimes looks better if the second column on the Table of Contents is right-aligned.

Other.Label: Move colophon to after included pages
Other.Description: The first line replaces the normal colophon including code with code that will output the page. The second line puts the normal colophon including code after any included documents.

Other.Label: Technique: Setting style parameters in ptxprint-mods.tex
Other.Description: This snippet is less a snippet as a technique. It shows two ways of setting style parameters from TeX.

Tracing.Label: g & P - figs, esbs, piclists
Tracing.Description:
\tracing{g}\tracing{P}
(parsing of arguments, making of the figure, positioning the caption, position on the page, etc.)}

Edits.Label: Remove all the redundant 0 lines
Edits.Description: Remove (delete) all lines where no adjustment has been specified.

Edits.Label: Split line once for multi-para adjustments
Edits.Description:
Expand out the multiple paragraphs
e.g. JAS 4.6 +0[2]% +[3] +[4]
becomes:
JAS 4.6 +0[2]
JAS 4.6 +0[3]% +[4]

Edits.Label: Split line multiple times for multi-para adjustments
Edits.Description:
Expand out the multiple paragraphs
e.g. JAS 4.6 +0[2]% +[3] +[4]
becomes:
JAS 4.6 +0[2]
JAS 4.6 +0[3]
JAS +[4]%

Edits.Label: Split ALL lines to a flatter list
Edits.Description:
Expand out ALL the multiple paragraphs
e.g. JAS 4.6 +0[2]% +[3] +[4]
becomes:
JAS 4.6 +0[2]
JAS 4.6 +0[3]
JAS +[4]%

Edits.Label: Highlight all shrinkable paragraphs
Edits.Description: Highlights any lines that could shrink (JAS 4.1 +-0) becomes (% JAS 4.1 -1)

-1 / +1.Label: Shorten this paragraph (apply -1)
-1 / +1.Description: Shrink (shorten) the paragraph at the cursor position.

-1 / +1.Label: Lengthen this paragraph (apply +1)
-1 / +1.Description: Grow (lengthen) the paragraph at the cursor position.
